quarks.runtime.etiao

Class ThreadFactoryTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.runtime.etiao.ThreadFactoryTracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory

    public class ThreadFactoryTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory
    Tracks threads created for executing user tasks.

    All user threads are interrupted when the tracker is shutdown. Runnable implementations (see Source) must exit the task if the current thread is interrupted. A handler which notifies the Executable is invoked when a user thread abruptly terminates due to an uncaught exception.

    If no ThreadFactory is provided, then this object uses the factory returned by Executors.defaultThreadFactory().

      Check to see if there are non daemon user threads that have not yet completed.

      Return a thread.
      void shutdown()
      This initiates an orderly shutdown in which no new tasks will be accepted but previously submitted tasks continue to be executed.
      void shutdownNow()
      Interrupts all user treads and briefly waits for each thread to finish execution.

    • Method Detail

      • newThread

        public java.lang.Thread newThread(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Return a thread.
        Specified by:
        newThread in interface java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        This initiates an orderly shutdown in which no new tasks will be accepted but previously submitted tasks continue to be executed.

      • shutdownNow

        public void shutdownNow()
        Interrupts all user treads and briefly waits for each thread to finish execution. User tasks must catch InterruptedException and exit the task.

      • hasActiveNonDaemonThreads

        public boolean hasActiveNonDaemonThreads()
        Check to see if there are non daemon user threads that have not yet completed. This includes non-daemon threads which have been created but are not running yet.
        Returns:
        true if there are active non daemon threads, false otherwise.
